pages.text: Aetosauroides scagliai comes from the Upper Triassic, with fossils found in the Ischigualasto Formation, Argentina, and Maria Formation, Brazil. It is a small aetosaur, growing up to 1 m with females, and 2 m with males. They are the oldest and most basal member of its group, showing less derived characteristics than its other relatives, like its serrated teeth, indicating a less herbivorous diet than later aetosaurs. Alongside this, its skull was also thinner,

including its mandibles, which would have not been able to support the beaks that its later relatives would evolve. The generic name derives from the genus name 'Aetosaurus'; and the Latin word 'oides', to mean 'like'.
